name: Ranjeet Mishra
body:
##Objective
To work in an organization where the culture of freedom and working for initiatives is ensured, facilitating my contribution through thoughts and action to the company’s vision and thus achieve self-development by playing a significant role in building the organization.

##Education
Bachelor of Technology (Electronics and Communication) from National Institute of Technology, Arunachal Pradesh
12th from MGK I C M PUR Kharkauni Naini Allahabad.
10th from S Dhara Singh H S S Bijaura Kashiram Nagar (Kasganj), U.P. 

##Summer Internship Project
Development of an animated version for interface of remote triggered fiber optic communication laboratory from Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati.
The project was on the development of the animated version of the virtual laboratory by JavaScript. Basically, the laboratory is in IIT Guwahati but anyone can use it on the internet from anywhere in the world with the help of virtual lab interface.
###Project url
http://202.141.81.59:8082/analog_and_digital/analog_and_digital.html

##Academic project
The solar cell has revolutionized the energy demand problems of the present and so various new techniques have come into practice to have the highest efficiency and to get the cost-effective equipment. Mainly we use silicon in the solar cell to get the high efficiency but silicon is a very expensive material that’s why various new technologies introduced by the researchers to reduce the cost of solar cell and get the high efficiency. In the second generation of the photovoltaic solar cell, thin film technology was used. It is made by the deposition of thin films of photovoltaic materials on the substrate like glass, plastic or metal. To increase the efficiency and reduce the cost of the solar cell we use chalcogenide materials in thin film technology.

##Areas of Interest 
Web Development
software Development
Wireless Communication
Digital Communication

##Personal Details
